bwwExcerpt:
“Purpose” toggles between the old and new — be it in discussions about political sacrifice, queerness or parenthood. This tension is so essential that designer Todd Rosenthal builds it into his set: a nod to classic architecture and proverbial Afrocentric homeyness accented with contemporary touches of recessed lighting and a trendy bouclé couch. This production has officially mastered the balance of distilling complex, intergenerational conflict into accessible, modern drama. And though many are the plays that have tried, it is “Purpose” that prevails.
Brittani Samuel
